bugs.title: CVE-2023-38522 trafficserver: Incomplete field name check allows request smuggling [fedora-39]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-38522 trafficserver: Incomplete field name check allows request smuggling [fedora-39]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-38522 trafficserver.apache.org: trafficserver: apache: Incomplete field name check allows request smuggling

long_desc.thetext:
Apache Traffic Server accepts characters that are not allowed for HTTP field names and forwards malformed requests to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.

This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300034

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-d40458db4b (trafficserver-9.2.5-1.el8) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-d40458db4b

bugs.title: CVE-2024-35161 trafficserver: Incomplete check for chunked trailer section allows [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-35161 trafficserver: Incomplete check for chunked trailer section allows [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-35161 trafficserver.apache.org: trafficserver: apache: Incomplete check for chunked trailer section allows

long_desc.thetext:
Apache Traffic Server forwards malformed HTTP chunked trailer section to origin servers. This can be utilized for request smuggling and may also lead cache poisoning if the origin servers are vulnerable.

This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.

Users can set a new setting (proxy.config.http.drop_chunked_trailers) not to forward chunked trailer section.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300035

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-d40458db4b (trafficserver-9.2.5-1.el8) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-d40458db4b

bugs.title: CVE-2024-35296 trafficserver: Invalid Accept-Encoding can force forwarding requests [fedora-40]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-35296 trafficserver: Invalid Accept-Encoding can force forwarding requests [fedora-40]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-35296 trafficserver.apache.org: trafficserver: apache: Invalid Accept-Encoding can force forwarding requests

long_desc.thetext:
Invalid Accept-Encoding header can cause Apache Traffic Server to fail cache lookup and force forwarding requests.

This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300036

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-EPEL-2024-d40458db4b (trafficserver-9.2.5-1.el8) has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2024-d40458db4b

bugs.title: CVE-2024-35296 trafficserver: Invalid Accept-Encoding can force forwarding requests [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-35296 trafficserver: Invalid Accept-Encoding can force forwarding requests [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-35296 trafficserver.apache.org: trafficserver: apache: Invalid Accept-Encoding can force forwarding requests

long_desc.thetext:
Invalid Accept-Encoding header can cause Apache Traffic Server to fail cache lookup and force forwarding requests.

This issue affects Apache Traffic Server: from 8.0.0 through 8.1.10, from 9.0.0 through 9.2.4.

Users are recommended to upgrade to version 8.1.11 or 9.2.5, which fixes the issue.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2300036

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.
